intro: Cyrtococcum patens, commonly known as the Patens Cyrtococcus, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Pottiaceae. It is a cryptogamic plant characterized by its small, thalloid structure and is typically found in moist, shaded environments. The plant lacks true roots, stems, and leaves, instead having a flat, ribbon-like body called a thallus. Cyrtococcum patens is often found growing on rocky surfaces or in soil in temperate regions. Its reproductive structures, known as capsules, are borne on stalks and release spores for propagation.
